title: Fine-Tuning a 3B Clinical LLM
description: Fine-tuned a compact 3B LLM for bladder-cancer clinical extraction, reaching 96% task accuracy in HIPAA-safe workflows.
detailSummary: This project focused on replacing costly larger-model extraction with a deployable 3B model while preserving strong performance for targeted clinical tasks.
detailBullets: Achieved 96% extraction accuracy on targeted tasks compared with a 94% GPT-4 benchmark workflow.
Used LoRA fine-tuning for structured extraction of clinical predictors in post-cystectomy bladder-cancer records.
Connected extracted features to downstream five-year survival modeling with multimodal records (text plus imaging context).

detailLinks.label: RSNA 2025 Podium Presentation
detailLinks.description: RSNA (Radiological Society of North America) hosts the largest global medical imaging meeting, with 50,000+ annual attendees across radiology, physics, and AI.

detailLinks.label: SPIE Medical Imaging 2026
detailLinks.description: SPIE Medical Imaging is a leading technical conference for imaging science and AI translation in radiology and clinical workflows.

citations: Day, R. G., Hadjiiski, L. M., Sun, D., Chan, H. P., Caoili, E. M., Cohan, R. H., Alva, A. S., Bruno, G., Zhou, C., Gulani, V. (2025). Performance Evaluation of a Fine Tuned Smaller Large Language Model (LLM) for Extracting Clinical Predictors of 5 Year Survival in Bladder Cancer Patients Post Cystectomy. RSNA Annual Conference, Chicago, IL.
Day, R. G., et al. (2026). LoRA Fine-Tuning of a Small 3B LLM for Clinical Information Extraction and Five-Year Survival Prediction in Bladder Cancer. SPIE Medical Imaging, Vancouver, Canada.

title: Streamlining Paper Selection
description: Built an internal LLM review pipeline that reduced screening time by 60% across 3,200+ articles while preserving auditable inclusion and exclusion decisions.
detailSummary: This workflow automated first-pass paper triage for systematic reviews and reduced manual burden while maintaining transparent decision logs.
detailBullets: Screened over 3,200 literature records using model-guided inclusion and exclusion criteria.
Cut reviewer cycle time by roughly 60% on high-volume screening stages.
Maintained structured logs so reviewers could inspect model decisions and rapidly resolve borderline papers.

detailLinks.label: AAHS Poster PDF
detailLinks.description: Direct poster PDF from the AAHS presentation on LLM-assisted screening for hand surgery systematic reviews.

citations: Day, R.G., Dunaway, C., Chen, Z., Gudi, M., Day, C.S. (2025). Leveraging Artificial Intelligence Models to Streamline Systematic Reviews in Hand Surgery. Poster presentation, AAHS Annual Conference, Waikoloa, HI.

title: Breast Cancer Detection (Subtype-First)
description: Led a 10+ student team to train subtype-first ViT pipelines (subtype then benign or malignant), improving baseline performance by +23.7%.
detailSummary: The team restructured the objective into subtype-first classification before benign or malignant prediction, producing stronger downstream discrimination.
detailBullets: Trained on BreakHis with subtype-aware objectives before final benign or malignant classification.
Improved bag-of-words baselines by +23.7% and CNN baselines by +11.2%.
Reached AUC 0.989 on the primary modeling track while coordinating implementation across a 10+ student team.

detailLinks.label: Project PDF
detailLinks.description: Direct PDF summary for the subtype-first breast-cancer classification project.

title: Blueprints for Pangaea Automation
description: Started and led technology initiatives that deployed automated pricing and image-naming workflows supporting $500K+ in medical supplies annually.
detailSummary: Blueprints for Pangaea is a nonprofit network that redistributes surplus medical supplies to communities with limited access; this work focused on measurable operational lift.
detailBullets: Supported internal tooling tied to approximately $500K in yearly inventory tracking and standardization workflows.
Organization impact is roughly $1M in redistributed supplies in 2025 and about $10M over its lifetime.
Implemented automation for product naming, pricing normalization, and image workflows using App Script, Python, OpenAI Agent SDK, and API integrations.

detailLinks.label: Blueprints for Pangaea
detailLinks.description: Blueprints for Pangaea connects surplus medical supply sources with global health partners to reduce waste and expand access to care.

detailLinks.label: Inventory Case Study
detailLinks.description: Case study showing inventory analysis and technology decisions used to improve redistribution operations.
